subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 30 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ranson withdraws Man City offer
Ray Ranson withdraws his bid to buy Manchester City.



 
Giggs ends international career
Wales captain Ryan Giggs announces his retirement from international football.



 
Retiring ref Poll hits out at FA
Referee Graham Poll, who is set to stand down, criticises the FA for failing to back him in a row over the dismissal of Chelsea's John Terry.








GOLF




Dredge eyes home Wales Open win
Bradley Dredge is on a quest to become the first home winner of the Celtic Manor Wales Open.



 
Cautious Rose to miss USA event
England's Justin Rose pulls out of this week's Memorial Tournament in America.



 
Hansen snatches victory from Rose
Anders Hansen edges a sudden-death play-off with Justin Rose to win the PGA Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




GB set finals target for Worlds
Athletics chiefs target a minimum of 14 British athletes reaching their finals at the World Championships in Japan.



 
Lewis-Francis pleased with upturn
Mark Lewis-Francis gives a hint of a possible upturn in form by finishing third to Asafa Powell in a 100m in Belgrade.



 
Redgrave rejects Chambers claims
Sir Steve Redgrave rejects Dwain Chambers' view that only athletes who use drugs can win Olympic titles.








CYCLING




Simoni wins tough mountain stage
Gilberto Simoni wins the 17th stage of the Giro d'Italia but fellow Italian Danilo Di Luca retains the overall lead.



 
Vinokourov team gains Tour place
Alexandre Vinokourov and Andreas Kloeden will ride in this year's Tour de France after their Astana team were given a wildcard.



 
Garzelli takes Giro stage success
Italian Stefano Garzelli wins the 16th stage of the Tour of Italy to Linz in Austria.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Liverpool owner mixes up his rap stars,  as Lewis Hamilton gets blinged up



 
Beck to the future
Robbo on how David Beckham's recall mirrors his return to the pub team



 
Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage
